articles.description: Researchers found that COVID patients had severely high blood protein levels called fibrinogen, which causes RBC clumping, altering blood flow and damaging linings of small blood vessels.
articles.content:
COVID-19 damages the cells lining the smallest blood vessels, choking off blood flow, and leading to organ damage, according to a study.
The results, published in the journal Nature Communications, … [+2115 chars]

articles.title: High Alcohol Consumption Increases Risk of All-Cause Mortality - Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine
articles.description: A new meta-analysis published in JAMA Network Open shows that mild to moderate drinking is as not protective as we once thought.
articles.content: A new meta-analysis published in JAMA Network Open shows that mild to moderate drinking is as not protective as we once thought. This review paper examined a collection of studies that included 4.8 m… [+490 chars]

articles.description: Bird Flu Rampage in Japan: No Land to Bury Dead Chickens | Vantage with Palki Sharma. A largescale outbreak of Bird Flu has infected chickens in Japan, which has been forced to cull the birds. The outbreak is affecting food prices in Japan. Palki Sharma tells…

articles.title: Want To Stay Young? 8 Tips On What And How To Eat - Slurrp
articles.description: What you eat and how you eat can impact your aging. According to Harvard Diet there are rules to follow and one can stay young by following these tips.
articles.content: Put your protein-rich foods in the final quarter of your plate. Choose from fish, poultry, beans, grains, tofu, quinoa, seeds, and nuts.

articles.title: Multiple rib and vertebral fractures associated with Bordetella pertussis infection: a case report - BMC Infectious Diseases - BMC Infectious Diseases
